name: 3-amino-1-(4-chlorophenyl)-1h-pyrazole
Reason: 3-Amino-1-(4-chlorophenyl)-1H-pyrazole has a melting point that we can analyze by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is 1-phenylhydrazine, which has a melting point of around 10 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in 3-amino-1-(4-chlorophenyl)-1H-pyrazole will affect its melting point: (1) The 4-chlorophenyl group introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +20 degrees Celsius. (2) The amino group introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +10 degrees Celsius. (3) The pyrazole ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +10 degrees Celsius.
